sourcesContent:
import './App.css'; import Divider from '@material-ui/core/Divider'; function Blog() { return (

January 2025

Our paper Modal Crash Types for WAR-Aware Intermittent Computing has been accepted for publication at TOPLAS!

Our work on intermittent computing has been selected for presentation at the POPL Student Research Competition. See you in Denver!


November 2024

I was invited to give a talk in the I2S Speaker Series at the University of Kansas. Thank you for hosting me!


October 2023

I am excited to present our work Correctness of Intermittent Executions via Modal Crash Types at the Midwest PL Summit this year!


April 2023

I am excited to vounteer and share our work on Crash types for intermittent computing at ESOP this year.


February 2023

I am grateful for the opportunity to attend FoPSS this year. I learned about probabilistic programming and quantitative analysis.


January 2023

Looking forward to student volunteering at POPL this year. See you in Boston!


December 2022

Our work on Modal Crash Types for Intermittent Computing has been accepted to ESOP 2023.


June 2022

Oregon-bound! Excited for all that I will learn at Oregon Programming Languages Summer School this year!


April 2022

Awarded the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship! Great thanks to my letter writers, advisors, and professors both at CMU and KU who have fostered my growth. It takes a village!

Grateful for the opportunity to attend CRA-WP Grad Cohort this year! I networked with many passionate computer scientists and gained valuable insight from industry and academic mentors.


January 2022

Had a blast at POPL PLMW this year! One of my favorite bits of wisdom is that "research is a conversation" (Stephanie Weirich).


December 2021

Woohoo, our team placed 2nd in the LFCPS Grand Prix! Special thanks to André Platzer for a great semester and to all the industry judges who came to hear about our project. Excited about our work on identifying modeling errors!


{/*

October 2021

It's a girl! Thrilled to be co-advised by Jan Hoffmann and Limin Jia. I am so excited for all that I will learn!


*/}

August 2021

"We're not in Kansas anymore", said a very confused Dorothy to an even more confused Toto. Same here (but less confused). Just moved to Pittsburgh, and I am thrilled to start grad school at Carnegie Mellon this fall! (no flying monkeys yet, but I'll let you know of any sightings.)


July 2021

Published website. Hello world :)

); } export default Blog;
